Perform algebraic manipulations involving equations, inequalities, fractions, absolute values, squares, and square roots
Work with the imaginary unit i (square root of -1)
Solve and factor simple second-order polynomials and find their roots
Apply basic rules for manipulating exponents and logarithms
Define and compose numerical functions (e.g., g(f(x)))
Identify standard number sets: ℝ, ℕ, ℤ, ℤ+, ℚ, ℂ
Use correct notation for set membership (e.g., x ∈ ℤ)
Know that 0 ∈ ℕ but 0 ∉ ℤ+ under the course convention
Understand closed and open intervals [a,b] and (a,b)
Apply the floor ⌊x⌋ and ceiling ⌈x⌉ functions
Know truth tables for logical operators, especially implication
Interpret inclusive OR unless otherwise stated
Understand universal (∀) and existential (∃) quantifiers and their scope
Translate between English statements and logical notation
Apply distributive, commutative, and associative laws in logic
Recognize that (p → q) is equivalent to (¬p ∨ q)
Evaluate logical equivalences using truth tables or counterexamples
Identify non-statements and statements with unbound variables
Determine the truth of complex statements from given components
Identify hypotheses and conclusions in if/then statements
Form negations of statements correctly
Determine the converse and contrapositive of implications
Simplify negations using DeMorgan’s laws and double negation
Negate quantified statements correctly
